results.title: The Clay circus
results.creator_credit: Texture Films and Herman J. Engel
results.brief_description: Captures, without narration, the spirit of the circus. A clay sculpture, by Shay Rieger, inspired by the color, forms, and motions of the circus, are intercut with segments of actual circus acts.

results.title: The Classroom
results.creator_credit: Eltham Films, Patrick Ryan and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children. Sebastian the Fox appears in a typical classroom with children playing pranks on their master as well as on each other. As so often happens the innocent are punished, in this case Sebastian. The offenders are eventually caught and receive their just desserts.

results.title: The Claim
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Andrew Eaton and Michael Winterbottom
results.brief_description: Directed by Michael Winterbottom (Butterfly kiss, Wonderland, 24 hour party people), “The Claim” is an adaptation of the Thomas Hardy novel “The Mayor of Casterbridge”. Set in the frontier town Kingdom Come, California, in the year 1867, “The Claim” plots the story of Daniel Dillon played by Peter Mullan (My name is Joe), a man who has amassed a fortune in mining and is the unofficial ruler the town. One day three people arrive in Kingdom Come who will upset Dillon’s world. Two are the wife (Natassja Kinski) and child (Sarah Polley) that he sold in a Faustian pact twenty years earlier in exchange his first gold claim, from which all his fortunes spilled. The other is a stranger, Dalglish (Wes Bentley), a land surveyor for the railroad who is seeking a path for the train line. Dalglish’s decision will determine the future of the town and Dillon, accustomed to getting his own way, seeks to sway the decision in his favour. Shot in Alberta, Canada, “The Claim” is a magnificent looking film that portrays frontier life as rudimentary, dangerous and lawless. Milla Jovovich also stars as a bar room singer, romantically invlolved with Dillon. Features a score by Michael Nyman.

results.title: The Claim
results.brief_description: About some of the processes of industrial negotiations. The progress of a log of claims is followed from its inception in the work place through its many stages of direct negotiations with the employer or through the process of conciliation and arbitration.

results.title: The City: time of decision
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Tibor Hirsch
results.brief_description: Surveys the spiraling problems faced by overcrowded cities in the US and some of the measures taken to solve them. Looks at the evolution of major cities, then examines such present ills as slums, traffic congestion, pollution and over-crowding. Among the solutions pictured are urban renewal projects, rehabilitation, electric transport, traffic regulatory techniques, pollution control devices and the so-called “new towns” such as Reston in Virginia. Narrated by Jim Jensen.

results.title: The city that waits to die
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: An alert from scientists concerned with a catastrophic fate for San Francisco based on earthquake conditions presented by the San Andreas fault. Includes scenes of earthquakes and describes some of the radical experiments being conducted in starting and stopping earthquakes.
results.description: SUMMARY: An alert from scientists concerned with a catastrophic fate for San Francisco based on earthquake conditions presented by the San Andreas fault. results.title: The City Speaks
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions and Housing Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: Made in 1965 showing the provision of housing for Melbourne’s growing population, 50,000 of whom live in 1,000 acres of inner suburban slums. Following demolition, large block of flats provide the amenities and home comforts for low income families at low rentals where children can play happily in well planned playgrounds. The historic footage of the demolition of inner city dwellings to accommodate high rise housing commission flats and the intentions behind the move are interesting to view in retrospect.

results.title: The City of women = La Citta delle donne
results.creator_credit: Opera Film Produzione, Gaumont-British Instructional and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: When Snaporaz (Marcello Mastroianni) follows an attractive woman off a train she leads him into the midst of a feminist seminar. So begins a fantastic journey as Mastroianni’s Don Juan finds himself meeting a bizarre coterie of female characters. In “La citta delle donne” Fellini confronts feminism in all its guises. Fellini is at once self-critical and indulgent but, as usual, his wonderful sense of fantasy makes this an enjoyable film to watch. In Italian with English subtitles. Note:During last 10 minutes of film some white lines may appear on screen. Adjust tracking on video player.

results.title: The City of the dead = Horror hotel
results.creator_credit: Vulcan Film (UK), Donald Taylor and John Moxey
results.brief_description: A young college student, intrigued by the historical practices of witchcraft conducted in the 17th century, travels to a small town for further investigation. There she meets a mysterious end, leaving her brother and boyfriend to uncover the truth about the town’s malevolent inhabitants. Filmed in black and white, and released the same year as Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, this horror tale is suitably menacing, relying very little on special effects, but more on atmosphere and a chilling narrative. Also known as “Horror hotel”.
